title: How Transit Agencies Are Trying to Make Your Commute Safe
sub_head: Masks, social distancing and public-private partnerships can help mass transportation systems weather the impact of the Covid pandemic
body:
Anyone planning to commute by public transit during or after the pandemic should care about what Sarah Meyer has to say.
A former public relations executive with Edelman, she left and took a pay cut in 2018 to become New York City Transitâ€™s first chief customer officer. Now Ms. Meyer, 37, oversees customer communications for millions of subway and bus riders and faces an unprecedented challenge.
